page.title: 09Clubs in Newton and Linton.
page.content: Several clubs are in existence at Linton-on-Ouse R.A.F. Station for R.A.F. personnel,with the addition of a Wives' Club.A Toddlers' Group,run by mothers, meets in Linton Village Hall. In Newton there is a thriving Bowls Club and a Women's Institute meeting in Newton Parish Hall,a Football Club and a Cricket Club.The Village Playing Field is used by the last two organisations.A branch of the Mothers' Union meets regulary,as does the Newton-on-Ouse and District Branch of the Royal British Legion, founded in 1921 and the Local History Group. Members of the organisations are drawn from Newton and Linton villages. There are no organisations or clubs for children and young people, and none at all in the Widdington area.
